Join us this #MemorialDay in remembering and honoring all those who made the ultimate sacrifice in service to our country.

LIVE: We're announcing the Phase 2 winners for our 
@NASAPrize
 Deep Space Food Challenge, a global competition to develop sustainable ways of producing healthy food for long-term missions to the Moon, Mars, and beyond.

Watch with us at #NYCxDESIGN:

Earth is our home. 

On #EarthDay and every day, we’re learning more about our world and how it’s changing – giving us a deeper appreciation for the planet we call home.

Celebrate with us: https://go.nasa.gov/3mZmeXx

We celebrate International #HumanSpaceFlight Day honoring the accomplishments of the first person in space in 1961, and the first launch of the space shuttle in 1981. 

Next, with 
@NASAArtemis
, we continue humanity’s progress with Moon & Mars exploration!

Tail installed 

Soon, 
@NASAAero
’s X-59 will take to the skies to demonstrate a new quiet form of supersonic flight. This technology could bring a return to supersonic flight over land—cutting flight times in half. More on the Quesst mission: https://nasa.gov/specials/Quesst/…

What's new on the Web(b)?

We always have the latest hi-res images from 
@NASAWebb
 available to view (and download) at http://webbtelescope.org. Stop by and make sure you haven't missed any!

One mission. Four astronauts. So many ways to watch the #Artemis II astronaut announcement.     The thread below tells you all the places you can find this historic event. We make history on Monday, April 3, starting at 11am ET (1500 UTC).

Need more space in your inbox? Subscribe to our weekly newsletter for the latest stories from across the universe.

¡También en español! http://nasa.gov/suscribete
Looking to do some stargazing? We’ve put together a handy guide with tips to help you find the best times and locations for enjoying the night sky: https://go.nasa.gov/3yQyoo2

This newly released Hubble image shows M55 – a loosely concentrated globular star cluster about 20,000 light-years away. 

Only a portion of M55 is seen here, but the whole cluster stretches about 100 light-years in diameter! Read more: https://go.nasa.gov/3LvT63O

Ok, bloomer: Spring is here. The March equinox marks the first day of spring in the Northern Hemisphere and autumn in the Southern Hemisphere. During equinox, the Sun shines on the equator with nearly equal amounts of day & night: https://go.nasa.gov/40hcGVO

"People need to realize not to make assumptions. Be open and curious about the abilities of everybody."
 
Dana Bolles is an External Information Technology Lead at NASA Headquarters. Discover how her community shapes her life, professionally and personally http://go.nasa.gov/3lgEBXb

When Irish skies are smiling...

This cloud-free view of Ireland, the Emerald Isle, was captured from space by our Aqua satellite back in 2010. Happy #StPatricksDay!

Recent volcanic activity has been observed on Venus for the first time.

Scientists made the discovery by poring over archival radar images of Earth’s twin taken in the '90s by our Magellan mission. Our VERITAS mission is set to investigate: https://go.nasa.gov/3mP5f9O

More views of Crew-5 departing the space station in the Dragon Endurance spacecraft last night! 
@NASA
 TV coverage resumes at 8pm ET, and before then, you can follow along with live mission audio coverage here:
https://youtube.com/live/3slokO2g1v0…

Data from the #Artemis I mission shows we’re ready for Artemis II, we captured stunning new imagery of a pulsar wind nebula, and testing continues on rockets that will return humans to the Moon—all that, This Week at NASA.
